an6.68:1.1: “Bhikkhus, it is impossible that a bhikkhu who enjoys association and company, who is fond of them and is devoted to enjoying them, would enjoy being alone in seclusion.
an6.68:1.2: Not enjoying being alone in seclusion, it is impossible that he will take the hints of the mind.
an6.68:1.3: Not taking the hints of the mind, it is impossible that he will fulfill Right View.
an6.68:1.4: Having not fulfilled Right View, it is impossible that he will fulfill Right Composure.
an6.68:1.5: Having not fulfilled Right Composure, it is impossible that he will give up the fetters.
an6.68:1.6: Having not given up the fetters, it is impossible that he will realize Nibbāna.
an6.68:2.1: But, bhikkhus, it is possible that a bhikkhu who doesn’t enjoy association and company, who isn’t fond of them and isn’t devoted to enjoying them, would enjoy being alone in seclusion.
an6.68:2.2: Enjoying being alone in seclusion, it is possible that he will take the hints of the mind.
an6.68:2.3: Taking the hints of the mind, it is possible that he will fulfill Right View.
an6.68:2.4: Having fulfilled Right View, it is possible that he will fulfill Right Composure.
an6.68:2.5: Having fulfilled Right Composure, it is possible that he will give up the fetters.
an6.68:2.6: Having given up the fetters, it is possible that he will realize Nibbāna.”
